entry.title: First Digital Pill Approved to Worries About Biomedical ‘Big Brother’
entry.quote: For the first time, the Food and Drug Administration has approved a digital pill — a medication embedded with a sensor that can tell doctors whether, and when, patients take their medicine.

entry.title: Amish Mutation Protects Against Diabetes and May Extend Life
entry.quote: Amish people living in a rural part of Indiana have a rare genetic mutation that protects them from Type 2 diabetes and appears to significantly extend their life spans, according to a new study.

entry.title: Yale Professors Race Google and IBM to the First Quantum Computer
entry.quote: Three giants of the tech world — Google, IBM, and Intel — are using a method pioneered by Mr. Schoelkopf, a Yale University professor, and a handful of other physicists as they race to build a machine that could significantly accelerate everything from drug discovery to artificial intelligence.

entry.title: What designers can learn from the iPhone X
entry.quote: 1. Turning a constraint into a feature, 2. Making technology human, 3. Towards a gesture driven future.

entry.title: Thinking About Design Thinking
entry.quote: I had a great morning convo with my Automattic Design colleague Mike Shelton that took me down the rabbit hole of successive Google image searches for design thinking and design sprinting diagrams
